Title: Use C++ to Blink an LED on a Raspberry Pi in Under 5 Minutes!
Description:
Dave shows you how to blink an LED connected to a GPIO pin of a standard Raspberry Pi 4.    For my book on the autism spectrum, check out: https://amzn.to/3zBinWM

For full details on wiringPi, which is needed to run this example, see their github: https://github.com/WiringPi/WiringPi

Basic steps to install it:
git clone https://github.com/WiringPi/WiringPi.git
cd WiringPi
./build debian
cd debian-template
sudo apt install wiringpifilewith.deb [Filename varies, subst your .deb file]

Dave's Attic - Friday 4PM Podcast - https://www.youtube.com/@UCtb6a_CnmGbSns9G8W2Ny0w

Title: The Stallman report
Description: October 14th, 2024 Richard Stallman (aka “RMS”) is the founder of GNU and the Free Software Foundation and present-day voting member of the Free Software Foundation (FSF) board of directors and “Chief GNUisance” of the GNU project. He is responsible for innumerable contributions to the free software movement, setting its guiding principles, organizing political action, and directly contributing to a flourishing free software ecosystem. The majority of Stallman’s political activity has been of priceless value to society at large.

Title: Mono vs Micro Repos

Title: High Performance Postgres with Rust, Cloudflare & Hyperdrive
Description:
Hello developers and architects, I'm James!

In this video, you'll explore how to efficiently connect Cloudflare Workers to external relational databases. Learn about Cloudflare's Hyperdrive service to enhance performance and reduce load.

You'll connect a Rust application to a Postgres database using Hyperdrive. Discover the ins and outs of setting up a secure and performant system while tackling the unique challenges of Cloudflare's global footprint and the scaling behaviour of serverless functions.

00:00 - Introduction and Overview
00:27 - Challenges of Connecting to External Databases
01:06 - Introducing Cloudflare Hyperdrive
01:24 - Setting Up Database Connections in Rust
03:21 - Direct Connection to Postgres Database
05:57 - Enhancing Performance with Hyperdrive
09:23 - Local Development and Testing
11:09 - Performance Testing and Results
13:23 - Troubleshooting and Best Practices
15:44 - Conclusion and Next Steps

Links
GitHub Repo - https://github.com/jeastham1993/serverless-cloudflare
Exograph Article - https://exograph.dev/blog/wasm-pg-explorations-2#hyperdrive-with-the-extended-query-protocol
Hyperdrive - https://developers.cloudflare.com/hyperdrive/
Neon Serverless Postgres - https://neon.tech/
Workers RS - https://github.com/cloudflare/workers-rs

Title: Perform custom validation in Blazor | BinaryIntellect Knowledge Base
Description: Validating form data is one of the most common task in any web application. ASP.NET Core offers a set of validation attributes for performing model level data validations. Blazor apps can also make use of the same validation attributes. Some of the validation attributes include [Required], [StringLength], [Range], and [Compare]. At times you want to perform some validation not covered by these attributes. This is when you want to create a custom validation attribute. In this article we will discuss how that can be done.
